Prod, Poke, etc.  Write the article please ;)

I've found it not only difficult to decouple code from frameworks,
but some frameworks make it very difficult to do TDD altogther.  As a
developer and user involved in some oss frameworks, I'm always
interested in different ideas that allow users of the framework to be
able to test unencubmbered by the framework along with decoupling ideas.

Mike Clark <mike@...> writes:

> J. B. Rainsberger wrote:
> 
> >Wonderfully. For those of you with taste, please prod me to get off my
> >ass and write my upcoming article, "Unit Testing within Frameworks",
> >which covers strategies for frameworks including EJB, Servlet, Turbine,
> >Struts and anything else people can suggest to me.
> >  
> >
> 
> Yes, please write that article already.  :-)
> 
> An alternative title comes to mind:
> 
>     "How to decouple your code from their framework"
> 
> People tell me that books and articles with "testing" in the title don't 
> sell as well as they'd like.  It's a shame really, and I hope to help 
> change that mentality.  One of my tactics in doing so, as you well know, 
> is to convince readers that testing is also a design activity.  As such, 
> I should be able to change any phrase about testing into a phrase about 
> design.  It's something I've been practicing, and this title is one 
> attempt.     
> 
> Now, please write that article!  :-)
> 
> Mike
>
